website_summaries.verdict: The best value. Rivals the feature set of higher-priced brands for a much lower price. Ideal for dog owners who prefer economy over durability.
pros: BestPet offers a line of spacious and affordable folding metal dog crates
They are easy to use and to clean, and offer features that are similar to those of more costly models
cons: We found that the metal wiring on this crate is thinner and more flexible than on other models

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply made
customer_reviews.text: cheaply made. Very very flimsy...trying to unfold them they were stuck together. We crimped the hooks so that the kennels won't collapse. I wouldn't suggest the kennel for big dogs because they could chew their way out easily. I am using mine for small dogs and puppies so I do think they will serve their purpose but I won't buy again. I would rather have heavier duty kennels that can take a little more abuse than these because we do have little kids around from time to time and they like to lean on the kennels and look at the dogs and puppies and these kennels are already bowed straight out of the box.
customer_reviews.author: MaTaylor67

customer_reviews.title: HUGE cage!
customer_reviews.text: this cage was larger than expected but perfect in every way. Its got a door on the top, which i don't understand but it doesn't cause any harm. This has to be the lowest priced cage I've ever seen! At first, i thought it was too good to be true. It is everything it says it is! The only complaint I have, is that the cage locks funny. its a great item to have! i have a 1 year old pit who outgrew her other cage. i feel like this will last a lifetime.
customer_reviews.author: Plainferkeeps

customer_reviews.title: Not for dogs, even the best of good-boys.
customer_reviews.text: My dog is kennel trained. He's a German Spitz (think slightly bigger Pomeranian) and well trained. He's not even remotely destructive or disobedient. He is however clever and once he noticed that this kennel is loose and wobbly he worked at the wire bars until he made a little exit for himself. The bars bend so easily and the welding just pops off with minimal pressure. I swear this kennel falls apart if you look at it wrong and it ended up in the recycling bin after a month of use. Spend a little more for the comfort and safety of your dog and avoid this kennel at all costs.
customer_reviews.author: Nitewender

customer_reviews.title: Big dog...not the best cage.
customer_reviews.text: I have a 60+ pound pitbull whom I left in there for 30 min while I went to the store and I came home to a big hole chewed out of the front door. So, just be careful if you have a larger dog or a dog who is capable of this. Luckily nothing harmed him, but the metal is definitely not reliable.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for dogs who are ok with being kenneled
customer_reviews.text: I've had this crate for a few years. I have used it for my dog and foster kittens. It has came in super handy. The only bad thing I can say is if you don't have a dog that is ok with being kenneled this is not the crate for you. It's pretty thin and can easy be gotten out of. My dog doesn't mind being kenneled so it's pretty much a formality so I know he isn't wondering around but if he really wanted to get out it would be super easy for him to break out. The tray is also pretty flimsy so count on replacing that eventually. I just use mine without the tray.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Not for large dogs
customer_reviews.text: I received my dog cage least expected was very happy when i got the cage early i thought i was going to have to wait until Monday i gave 5 stars because of the large size my dog is small hes a yorkie the cage does have some down falls 1st the black slide in tray is very flimsy the tray already cracked and 2 the cage is flimsy to also not intended if you have a large dog overall it works cheap and over priced
customer_reviews.author: Bubbliciousbubbleyum

customer_reviews.title: That's why it was so cheap...it's junk.
customer_reviews.text: This cage is cheaply made, flimsy to the point of being unsafe, and not even put togather correctly. The product did not match the discription of the item, no top door as advertised... The bars just snap off their mounts with little pressure. I purchaced one and after 4 days it fell apart. Upon contacting Amazon,and explaining the issue they told me I was eligible for a refund for a defective product. However the sellers policies and unwillingness to work with you for a with a refund simply by mailing me a shipping lable have made it nessasary for an A to Z claim.
customer_reviews.author: Hunter

customer_reviews.title: Not Recommended for Dogs with Separation Anxiety
customer_reviews.text: Bought this kennel for my growing pup. I love the fact that there are 2 doors and have other option which side to put near the wall. I am only giving this product 2 stars due to its durability. Like other reviews, my pooch tried to shred this thing to pieces in order to get out and although we we're able to stop him, most pieces were bent and out of place. Therefore, this is not a great product for dogs' with separation anxiety or even power chewers due to poor quality.
customer_reviews.author: JayT

customer_reviews.title: This cage was easy to assemble and helped train my dog from being ...
customer_reviews.text: This cage was easy to assemble and helped train my dog from being anxious when new people came into our home. We needed in home caregivers and he became so uptight he would nip the back of anyone's thighs if the walked to the bedroom area to chase them out. He didnt wany anyone bothering my brother in law who was bed ridden at the time. Care givers dont like being bitten by an 80 lb dog. Once he gets to know you he is very friendly but the cage allowed us to train him most strangers are okay.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas H.

customer_reviews.title: Stay away!! Don’t waste your time or money!
customer_reviews.text: I’d leave ZERO stars if possible! This cage would work for a small dog but definitely not the dog even pictured in the picture for the advertisement! My dog was in this cage for 2 hours minutes after assembling and was able to get out of the cage in that little amount of time! This is a waste!! It’s unsturdy and not worth the time it takes to get it out of the box!
customer_reviews.author: Sunnikae

customer_reviews.title: Poor Quality
customer_reviews.text: The bigger they get the more flimsy they are. Have a hard time latching, very troublesome. Dog can escape if they are determined so easy to bend the wire. I figured if i purchased from a different co. it would be better but i think this one is cheap compared to the one that got tore up by my dog. Crate gone and so is dog.
customer_reviews.author: Tammie

customer_reviews.title: Horrible material
customer_reviews.text: Didn’t think I’d need to read a review for a dog crate. Guess I learned my lesson. Put my dog in here for no more than an hour or two while I took my daughter to get dinner. Came back to the door bent and my dog out. Trying out the zip tie suggestion I read on another post. Fingers crossed! Luckily my dogs already potty trained and only needs this to prevent her from tearing things up while she’s alone. Really hoping it works because I bought it for while we’re on vacation so she’s not stuck outside in the heat and dirt in between dog sitter visits.
customer_reviews.author: stacie

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with this!!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is huge. Lol. Has a handle so its easy to carry when folded. Easy to store when not being used. Also has a decider incase you have 2 dogs or need to use it to kennel train. Definitely got our moneys worth!
customer_reviews.author: Naomi Saunders

customer_reviews.title: Good purchase and quick shipping
customer_reviews.text: The package arrived in two days and was in perfect condition. Great price, the same style at PetCo is $129.00. Good and sturdy and should last a long time, also easy to set up.
customer_reviews.author: Riana OK

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Crate, Amazing Price
customer_reviews.text: So our little puppy (who I believe must be related to Bigfoot) quickly outgrew her old crate so I ordered this one. I am amazed at the crate for the price! Well less than 1/2 the price of the same size crate everywhere else. I was worried about the construction, that it wouldn't last, but it's extremely sturdy. I'll add a pic of our puppy in it later. The tray slides out easy for cleaning. I like the two door access, very convenient. Would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Superstefmom

customer_reviews.title: Adequate and Good Price
customer_reviews.text: Good sized kennel for a good price. However it is very flimsy, not like the regular kennels you would buy in a store. So if you have a dog w separation anxiety, or one that isn't crate trained I wouldn't suggest it. One of my dogs has confinement anxieties and bends kennels, so this wouldn't work for her. But my other 2 who just chill in their crates this works just fine for them. So basically know your dog. 3 stars bc of the price and the size, but also bc it is a cheaper built kennel. Oh, and I hate the way you have to lift the latches. That's just my preference though
customer_reviews.author: Kate

customer_reviews.title: Complete trash
customer_reviews.text: I understand trying to use less sturdy material to make things cheaper, but this is insane. There is no way I would leave my dog alone in this crate. The material is so flimsy and flexible that almost any dog could easily flex the corner of a door enough to fit a foot, leg, or even their head through it. I'm not about to risk my dog injuring itself just to save a few bucks. Definitely being returned.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy. Not for escape artists. Fits a 60lb dog comfortably.
customer_reviews.text: Flimsy compared to Walmart, PetCo and Hollywood Feed crates. I do not suggest this crate for stubborn dogs that may attempt a jail break. Thet will either mangle the kennel or themselves. Our Texas Heeler fits nicely in it and we like the side door.
customer_reviews.author: Player1

customer_reviews.title: Cheap and falling apart. Waste of money for 6 months use
customer_reviews.text: Purchased in Jan 2020 (its June 2020 now) and has been falling apart piece by piece since day one. The bottom tray is flimsy, the metal bars are breaking at the welds. Horrible. The hooks that latch the sides and top do not hold together.
customer_reviews.author: SECZ

customer_reviews.title: Great cage for a great price.
customer_reviews.text: We purchased two of these cages for our pitbulls. They are more than plentiful in room for two 80lb+ pits. The dogs love to be in their "rooms." I take one cage with us when we go offroading in the desert. Both dogs fit in the cage comfortably.They arrived packaged well, and set up extremely easily. The tray slides out without having to disassemble the cage for cleaning. When they need to be folded up for storage, they fold up and store away without any hitches. I just rescued a third pitbull puppy, and will purchase another cage for her.
customer_reviews.author: Racereddy20

customer_reviews.title: NOT for a strong dog unless you modify !
customer_reviews.text: My 3.5 month old boxer puppy bent the front door of the crate and made his escape on the first crating. I had to bend all the metal connector tabs with a pair of adjustable pliers to make the crate strong enough to keep my puppy in it without escaping. This makes folding the crate down impossible. Other than the weak design, its a good crate. Just don't get this for a dog that is strong and active. It has lots of room, just not much structural integrity without modification. For the price, its worth modifying! I paid less than twenty on Sale!
customer_reviews.author: Rick J

customer_reviews.title: Terrible for larger dogs too flimsy
customer_reviews.text: This cage is fine if you have a little tiny fluff dog but is not good for larger dogs. My lab broke out of the latched kennel in 5 minutes. The latches are weak and the wire is very thin. Disappointed to say the least with this kennel. I wish I could send it back. Should have spent the extra 10 bucks and got the better made kennel from another store with a thicker wire and secure latches
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the large for my standard poodle puppy to grow into. She's crate trained & doesn't challenge it, but I believe it's sturdy. It is a little (very little) more wobbly than the ones 2 or 3 times the price, but not enough to pass on this. My cat has a flat bed on top & it doesn't bow the top or anything. My cat is pretty fat. :) The lock is a slight pain. Sometimes it catches when sliding it open. But not a big deal to me at all. I would absolutely buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: L. D.

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality and Extremely Spacious
customer_reviews.text: This thing is massive. I have a 50 lb lab mix and she can stand up without touching the ceiling and lay down without touching the sides. Some reviews were concerned about the build quality but unless you have a 100+ lb dog in this thing that REALLY wants to get out there is absolutely nothing to worry about. Even then I doubt the thing would collapse or break. The construction quality is just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy this crate!
customer_reviews.text: My puppy had to go to urgent care after only being in this crate for 30 minutes. My husband and I went out for a bit and this was not a safe crate at all. He is only a puppy, 16 weeks old, and he hurt himself breaking through. Do not get this crate, we are blessed it wasn’t any worse. This was bad enough. I never do reviews but this has been an eye opener for us. Never crating our puppy again! Please know what you are buying when it comes to your puppy.
customer_reviews.author: Gyongyver Shaffer

customer_reviews.title: Not heavy duty but good for less rambunctious dogs.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased 42” cage for my lab puppy. This cage is giant. I love the option of a side door- which we use more than the end door and it’s super convenient. I will note this cage is not heavy duty and seems pretty weakly built. This is a great buy for a wel behavied dog but I can see a rambunctious dog being able to tear this cage apart.
customer_reviews.author: Kenzie

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: Plastic base tray came with a corner piece broken off. The plastic handle that you use to carry it is very cheap and detaches itself with the slightest bump or even the motion of opening and closing of the gate.
customer_reviews.author: Ada L. King

customer_reviews.title: Great crate! Me and my dog are both happy!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 5 month old German Shepherd. It's quite roomy and the perfect size for her to grow into. It came quickly and is made rather well. My dog isn't a biter and won't claw to get out. I had a 36 inch crate that fit her fine, but this will be perfect for her, even when she's fully grown. I was thinking of getting the biggest one,( 48 inches) but I read a lot of reviews and most said that the 42 inch was roomy enough for a full grown Shepherd, they were right and I'm happy that I bought this one.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberlee427

customer_reviews.title: Very large, decent cage.
customer_reviews.text: It’s a great cage. But be mindful, it’s giant. It fits all three of my dogs in it with extra room. They all can stand up too. This is wonderful. The only problem is it’s an inch too big for the space I live in... image that too big for me lol.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Jaco

customer_reviews.title: Bendable, Breakable, Bad
customer_reviews.text: We have a 45lb dog, that is of medium size. She decided that while we were gone, to bend the bars and break them on 1 side and escape. Upon doing so, she tore our carpet, chewed our lamp cord, chewed our phone cord, and peed on our bed. So now we're out a lamp, phone cord, and money for the carpet. At first it seemed to be a good cage, but just after only being gone for 6 hours, it didn't last.
customer_reviews.author: Randall Jordan

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: My Jazzy absolutely loves it!! She is a lab mix. She is 5 months old right now and I knew I needed to get a bigger cage. She ran right in it and relaxed. I think it's safe to say that she approves.
customer_reviews.author: sonia

customer_reviews.title: Horrible and flimsy!
customer_reviews.text: Without question the worst kennel I've ever purchased. The kennel was extremely flimsy! The wire breaks off & bends very easily. My 4 dogs broke all 4 of the kennel within 6 days of purchase. Pay more money for a kennel without flimsy wires.
customer_reviews.author: Tamia Perkins

customer_reviews.title: You want your dog to be happy with her own things, especially her bed.
customer_reviews.text: I just needed a crate my lab could sit without hitting her head, she stretches out and is comfortable. I use the side gate and she goes in and out like a child going for a nap. Very happy with product. Thanks, Peg
customer_reviews.author: Margaret Clark

customer_reviews.title: Great for our dog
customer_reviews.text: We own a bigger dog. He weighs roughly 80 lbs, and this crate is just the right size for him. He has enough room to fully get comfortable and some left over for his water bowl. Very nice price.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great value but a little hard to lock.
customer_reviews.text: Good product for the price. Locks are a little out of line causing it to be difficult to lock both sometimes. For the price I would buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!!!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my 14lb Mini Schnauzer I know its a little overkill but now she has a doggy condo. It had very easy assembly. The only problem with it was when I first got it and there was no foam in the box that it was shipped in, so from it rattling around during shipment one of the metal hinges got shoved under another wire and I could not get it to go together. But a quick fix with some needle nose pliers and bent it back into place. Not really the products fault but thought I would mention it. This thing isn't any different from the one at PetSmart for over 100 dollars. I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Cathy T

customer_reviews.title: For the price?  Great.
customer_reviews.text: Pretty cheap design, but works very well!!! One of our dogs somehow figured out how to open them... what the f***?!?!?! But we put a key chain thing on it now to keep her from getting out. All in all? Worth the price as long as you don't care about modifying it. *I'd suggest crimping the attach points for the front and back, otherwise sometimes it slips down. **Does rust easily if left outside.
customer_reviews.author: Buspawnic

customer_reviews.title: Latch is a poor design. Not sure what kind of material is ...
customer_reviews.text: You get what you pay for. Latch is a poor design. Not sure what kind of material is used but it is flimsy compared to my other kennel. Divider is a joke. Tray on one of them came warped. Overall, it looks and feels cheap. Thank goodness my dogs are crate trained so they don't try to escape, but I would imagine if your dog does to escape, do not buy this one. I only gave it two stars because it gets the job done. That said, if I didn't get these two kennels for free, I'd return them.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua

customer_reviews.title: Perfect option.
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly what I was looking for at a much discounted price. Very well made. I work 12+ hour shifts and wanted to leave my Lucy in a crate while gone. I wanted one big enough for a bed and small food and water dish. I hated the idea of being gone so long and her not having substance. She's an American Cocker Spaniel. 5 months old at the time of this review. She has plenty of room to make me feel less horrible about leaving her to go to work.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah N Gates

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: We got the Large and it is HUGE and I see complaints about the locking on this crate and how it’s made I thought it was made pretty well and the locking is great each gate locks in 2 places and it’s so big you could easily fit 2 medium to large breed dogs in it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: it is easy to fold up/down and we really like the plastic ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a well built crate and works perfectly for our German Shepherd. To be fair, I'm not sure that any crate could keep her in if she really wanted to get out. The trick for us was to tell her kennel and give her a treat each time she went into it. In one day we could say kennel regardless of what she was doing and she would "kennel up". We have taken it with us when traveling, it is easy to fold up/down and we really like the plastic pan, it is easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Adobe 11SD

customer_reviews.title: Only if it fits
customer_reviews.text: For already crate trained dogs or young pups maybe. Wires bend crazy easy compared to the other wire crate I had. I have to be very careful when breaking it down.
customer_reviews.author: Danyelle Brazell

customer_reviews.title: Easy to fold away.
customer_reviews.text: Have this for about 5 years now, did get a little rusty but thats normal. I love that it has two doors so you can put it anyway you want. Easy to assemble and fold for storage its awesome. We can fit it under our low bed when we need to.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: Big Kennel
customer_reviews.text: Not quite as easy as they lead one to believe to set this up. My serious concern is its sturdiness - not in terms of the dog, but in terms of the humans who believe somehow it is built to hold their human weight, given the flat surface on top, I suppose. It bothers me that if the dog is inside when some fool leans or sits down on the top, the entire thing will collapse on the dog, killing it. Seems adequate for its purpose (containing the dog), but I have yet to close the door. Right now we just have another place for the dog to curl up in.
customer_reviews.author: Anna

customer_reviews.title: Very heavy for Traveling!!️
customer_reviews.text: It’s too big for my trunk. I should have ordered a size smaller. I need it for traveling but it’s so big and heavy that I will probably never use it.
customer_reviews.author: Riley HuggleSnuggle

customer_reviews.title: Awesome dog kennel for our puppy
customer_reviews.text: We have a 10 week old german shepard/black lab and he fits perfect in this with plenty of room for when he gets bigger. The setup is nice for the price. I found ones similar to these at Petsmart and Walmart and they were charging $70+. The latches/locks on the doors were annoying at first but we got used to them. We just had to lift up slightly first and then slide them to open the door. Otherwise we are happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha

customer_reviews.title: You kinda have to fold it out like you're going to break it
customer_reviews.text: At first, I couldn't get it unfolded, I thought it was getting caught, but I just forced it and it popped open and was quite easy. Don't worry about breaking it when unfolding
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy and very unstable!
customer_reviews.text: This cage is extremely flimsy. If you are using to crate train do not purchase this! If you are using for an animal who already is crate trained like I am, it’s usable but I’ll be getting a more sturdy cage soon.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda lynn

customer_reviews.title: Worth Every Penny
customer_reviews.text: The metal of the crate is not as sturdy as I would have thought it should be but it does not seem to affect the performance of the crate at all. This crate has held up to my one year old hound / lab mix very well. I would purchase this crate again if the need arises by adding another dog to the family.
customer_reviews.author: Cuncabo

customer_reviews.title: Nice carrier that's easy to put together and tear down.
customer_reviews.text: We needed a carrier to move our cats from Chicago to Florida. When it arrived on time I was please at how easy it was to put together. It has a nice tray on the bottom and another piece that allows you to slit the cage. Doors are easy to open and close and, for the price, this was a great buy. Fits in our SUV tight, which we knew, but allows the cat box and the cats to fit comfortably in the carrier.
customer_reviews.author: Batrunner6

customer_reviews.title: Love the Crate!
customer_reviews.text: I got this crate for my big outside cat, to contain him after I move to another state for awhile until he knows this is home. I have two inside cats and they don't all get along, hence the need for outside containment of the outside cat. The crate is a great size, folds, and is relatively easy to manage. It was exactly what I expected from the description. Only critique was the shipping delivery--The shipping guy left it on the patio, didn't let me know it had arrived, and didn't even bring it up the steps to the deck. Seller might want to consider another shipping company.
customer_reviews.author: Carol J. Garriott

customer_reviews.title: If you have a good dog who doesn't mess with the kennel
customer_reviews.text: If you have a good dog who doesn't mess with the kennel, it's great purchase. Luckily mine doesn't. If you have a dog who tries to escape..they will out of this. It isn't the sturdiest. It does the job as the kennel I take when she travels and folds up nicely for storage. The handle makes carrying it a lot easier too. She is a 60 lb boxer with slight separation anxiety (she only barks when in the kennel) and does minor scratching at the door.
customer_reviews.author: Helen

customer_reviews.title: Very good for the price
customer_reviews.text: When our dog was laying down, I measured her. Then looked online and found this. It's a good size for her and I like that it's collapsible so we can bring it camping with us. She is a complete lunatic when a stranger comes to the door and this thing keeps you right in line. No problems. I would recommend this to anyone. It seems sturdy in it's construction yet lightweight enough. The latches appear to be very well designed in my opinion and I haven't had any issues with the dog escaping.
customer_reviews.author: Michael S. Tollefson

customer_reviews.title: Great Value!
customer_reviews.text: A great value for this kennel. This is my second time purchasing the exact one (the 1st one is still in use and doing well 1 year later, we just wanted on in a 2nd location) The kennel is perfect for my Bloodhound. I would say that it is definetly not a good kennel for a dog that will try to get escape, as it is not very strong. My dog enjoys kennel time, it's her "dog cave" and personal space so this kennel works well for us. I like the multiple entry doors as we have to turn the kennel sideways to fit in the room.
customer_reviews.author: Pen Name

customer_reviews.title: Large crate, thin wire in the mesh
customer_reviews.text: Pro: The crate is roomy and the pan is a nice addition. Con: The wire used in the crate is thin and too malleable. The front pops loose from the bent tabs with the slightest pressure. Solution: I used zip ties to hold the crate ends in place. The front does not pop loose merely from opening the door anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Marvin D. Adams

customer_reviews.title: this is a great cage! i got this so my golden retriever/pyrenees ...
customer_reviews.text: this is a great cage! i got this so my golden retriever/pyrenees mix would have a bigger crate and so my pit puppy could have his own crate, and my golden doesnt even have to duck to walk into this one...its perfect for her! easy to set up, just has a different latch, the part that you slide back and forth to latch the crate has a L-shape on the end instead of being just a straight bar, but thats no big deal :)
customer_reviews.author: Heather Nicolai

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy and arrived broken. Returning immediately.
customer_reviews.text: When I pulled this out of the box, it was covered in dust and the metal was somehow sticky. It didn't assemble well at all, and was extremely flimsy, I could bend it just by placing my hand on top of the crate. On top of that, one of the doors wasn't even attached to the side it was supposed to be on. The hinges literally weren't attached to any metal. Returning this, but I'll have to pay shipping =(
customer_reviews.author: Dee

customer_reviews.title: This crate is the perfect size I needed
customer_reviews.text: This crate is the perfect size I needed! I'm thrilled to know i won't have any more puppy poop piles on my floor! The only thing is that i wish it was easier to slide the removable tray out. All in all though, I'm very pleased. I have two catahoula bulldogs that are expected to be huge. I only bought one crate for them to share until i could see the quality, but now I'll be putting my order in for a second crate. Great price, great product, money WELL SPENT!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: do not buy
customer_reviews.text: Please do not buy this product I bought a large for my puppy she was only in it an hour and broke some of the wires I had to go to work so I closed the door thinking it would hold her 2 hour's later when s check she got out and now I have hundreds of dollar's in damages to my apartment this company should not sell this product ment for large dogs if it cant even hold a medium size puppy
customer_reviews.author: natasha. ayudan

customer_reviews.title: Awesome for crate trained or puppy in training dogs:)
customer_reviews.text: Great crate! Especially for the price! My dog is crate trained so he doesn’t make any attempts to escape. It s strong and seems durable, however if you have a large dog who hates to be crated and tries every which way to escape, you may need something stronger...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A joke......
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this crate for my beagle because people were saying that it was handling their much larger dogs just fine. My beagle was in the crate twice and broke out. My little beagle pulled apart the bars at the doors and escaped. The worst part is that, not only did it cost 1/3 of the purchase price to have the poorly constructed crate shipped to me, the company said it would refund me for the purchase of the crate but I had to pay another 1/3 of the purchase price to ship it back. What a joke! Horrible product...pay the extra for better quality.
customer_reviews.author: Tina

customer_reviews.title: Could not be happier
customer_reviews.text: This crate is fabulous. It is not quite as sturdy as our smaller crate but certainly does the job. The coating seems to wear off the latch from use rather quickly. It also sticks a little. But it folds up nicely for travel and our ten month old Australian Shepherd mix likes it fine. More than ample room for him. He's 52 pounds right now and he can stretch out with no problem. Great deal for the money. Would not hesitate to buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Anna Feather

customer_reviews.title: Nice Crate - Not a Cage
customer_reviews.text: Adequate for my golden retreivers but I can see where a brutal dog (say a pit bull) could easily damage this crate. The metal is lightweight and would not withstand too much pressure. It is NOT made to contain a dog that wants to escape, only a dog that is content to be inside of it. If your dog is content to be inside a crate this one is awesome. I have put both of my adult golden retreivers in here together comfortably.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic cage for rabbits! :)
customer_reviews.text: I am using this cage for my rabbit...the cage is a perfect size for him (he loves it)...latches are a bit tough to open and close but you'll get the hang of it! :) nothing broken, came in very quickly!!!! (about three days! :D way earlier than the estimate) , extremely easy to assemble and clean :) and Buddy has no way of getting through the little openings everywhere, so don't worry about that when you get the cage because my bunny is quite small :P definetly thankful that I bought this! great product!!!!! <3
customer_reviews.author: Asha Nandety

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for our mellow dog at a great price
customer_reviews.text: Set this up in two minutes. Perfect for our 80-pound German Shepherd (we got the 42" crate.) The latches work perfectly fine. Very lightweight. Some reviews stated it's flimsy, but our dog does not try to get out of it or push on it, so it's sturdy enough for our use. If you have a dog who doesn't try to destroy his crate and just lays in it, this crate is perfect. And for the price, you can't beat it.
customer_reviews.author: DeeL42

customer_reviews.title: My puppy broke the crate!
customer_reviews.text: I got this a couple months ago for my puppy who is now about 4 months old. She has broken two of the little bars off- by chewing or pushing on them? I'm not exactly sure how. Several other parts of it are bent and I expect those will be broken soon as well. I don't know how much longer I'll be able to use the crate. And she's only 4 months old, not a big full grown adult dog! I guess this is what you get for a bargain price.
customer_reviews.author: Kristen

customer_reviews.title: Not strong at all
customer_reviews.text: 6 month old small lab mix puppy tore this crate apart in an hour. It's a great price for a good sized crate, but unless you have a very docile pup your better off investing the extra $10 for a better quality crate. This crate didn't last one day. Basically, if a visual barrier is good enough for your dog than this may work.
customer_reviews.author: Bloodymary

customer_reviews.title: I love these types of folding crates because they go up ...
customer_reviews.text: I love these types of folding crates because they go up fast and collapse easily. I use one to travel/camp with my dog. I give this 4 stars instead of 5 because the latches can be a little tricky. Sometimes it takes me a minute to get it lined up right and opened. The tray is heavy, sturdy and easy to clean and I like having the two doors since I use it in different camping situations!
customer_reviews.author: Paula B Campin

customer_reviews.title: The metal grates aren't very sturdy. A determined dog could press himself out through ...
customer_reviews.text: The metal grates aren't very sturdy. A determined dog could press himself out through the seams between grates. Nothing a little string in key places doesn't take care of, but just be aware that if your dog doesn't like crates, s/he can probably get out of this one. But it was super cheap for its size, so what can I really expect?
customer_reviews.author: J. Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Great price, great product!
customer_reviews.text: We got one of these for a boxer and a miniature schnauzer to share- I could probably fit 3 more dogs in here COMFORTABLY! So worth the money and I can tell my babies are happier - they'll actually go into their cage when it's time for me to go with no problems now! Some people have questioned the sturdiness of these cages and I honestly think they're as good as anything else unless maybe your dog is just crazy in their cage. Perfectly great for any normal mannered dogs!
customer_reviews.author: Katie Moss

customer_reviews.title: Secured
customer_reviews.text: Been using this type of cage for the better part of 10 years, Each of my dogs have their own space and seem to enjoy knowing it is theirs. Besides their being secured when necessary, I think the mail and delivery people are much safer. No matter how calm a critter may seem, there is always the off chance of a negative reaction. Keeping them safe and secure from teasers and them from destroying personal belongings.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: satisfied
customer_reviews.text: this crate suits its purpose nicely, but the latches on the door is a little to difficult to operate.
customer_reviews.author: Carolyn M.

customer_reviews.title: great product for great price, great deal
customer_reviews.text: We had gotten this item back in Nov 2014 and so far it's been great. Dog was able to bend some of the wiring which kinda sucks but still it's intact and dog has plenty of room to move around and lay in it at night or when we are away from the house. Hope to make purchase of this item again when we get a second dog. But I do appreciate the time it took to get here and very content with the item.
customer_reviews.author: Mariely D Sheridan

customer_reviews.title: My dog is only 11 pounds and he has plenty ...
customer_reviews.text: My dog is only 11 pounds and he has plenty of space and doesn't mind going in there when he knows he can't come with me. I put a small divider in on the opposite end of the door with a pad so he can handle his business. I also bought the food and water trays that can attach to the cage high enough where its well off of the floor but accessible enough for him to use.
customer_reviews.author: Will

customer_reviews.title: That it will keep my dog contained while i was away
customer_reviews.text: Just to keep our puppy in for awhile. It was necessary. My husband was in the hospital and had to keep her in it for awhile. She's young and rambunctious and i couldn't let her chew my house apart while i was away. Plus she had plenty of room!
customer_reviews.author: Capridawn

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly for us!
customer_reviews.text: These types of crates are great. Easy to erect and break down. And the 3 doors are great. We use the side door and took off the top door. This is our puppy's 'condo'. They like an open top. I had a really hard-to-fit area for their bed. The dimensions on this crate are perfect. Large enough to fit two little dog beds and blankets. I couldn't be more thrilled.
customer_reviews.author: DaniK

customer_reviews.title: So Roomy!
customer_reviews.text: I have a 30 pound collie and this kennel is perfect for him. There's plenty of room for him to lay down and stretch out or pace around while he waits for me to come home. This cage is very simple to fold up or down for transport and the three doors ensure that you always have easy access. My only complaint is that somehow my dog can get the bottom lock unlatched and squeeze himself out if he feels rebellious enough - but for the incredibly cheap price - that's a flaw I can live with.
customer_reviews.author: Katy Davis

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this crate for our one year old pit bull mix who likes to poo up the house when we leave him home alone. It is a thin metal, but still sturdy enough to hold him without problem, and he is a rowdy dog. There's plenty of room to accommodate him as he grows. I'd recommend this crate without hesitation.
customer_reviews.author: Anna Snow

customer_reviews.title: Ok crate but damaged
customer_reviews.text: The bottom tray was cracked with sharp edges. The wire was more thin and flimsy than previous crates we've purchased. Would have been ok for my dog but not ideal for an escape artist. The extra side door is nice. Hoping the seller will approve my return since it's not usable with the cracked plastic.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Great Crate!
customer_reviews.text: Great quality! Other brands have gotten bent and our Pitbull puppy was able to break free. This crate keeps her safe inside of the crate. Would buy again!
customer_reviews.author: Karen Brooks

customer_reviews.title: Love the cage
customer_reviews.text: Love the cage. I have a 5 yr old pit who was destroying my house I was running out of places to leave her while no one was home. The cage figs her perfect with room to move. Also came with instructions on how to get the dog used to staying in the cage which work. My dog goes in there by herself she's not jumping on couches anymore to sleep or destroying my house. I would definitely recommend this item. It was easy to set up too.
customer_reviews.author: sp

customer_reviews.title: Not a good buy for my dog
customer_reviews.text: My Portuguese Water Dog, literally chewed thru the plastic floor pad and now we can not use the crate
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I have a 50lb pit and this works great for him
customer_reviews.text: Item came in a week. I have a 50lb pit and this works great for him. There is a cage divider if you have more than one dog you have to put up, which only houses small dogs at that point. My pit has enough room to stretch out, stand, or sit up. There are two latches on two sides. I only use one latch on one side and he can't get out so o know this bad boy is durable. DEFINITELY BUY!!! Worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My fiance and I bought this because we were going ...
customer_reviews.text: My fiance and I bought this because we were going to purchase a puppy to crate train. It has served its purpose very well and is QUITE roomy. My only issue with the crate is a small one, and that's one of the latches for the crate door getting stuck often. You really have to yank on it to get the booger open. Could just be the one I bought, but don't be surprised.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea

customer_reviews.title: Modified for my rabbitry! :-)
customer_reviews.text: These crates are an amazing deal. I modify them for rabbits by lining the bottom and 5 inches up the sides with "baby saver rabbit wire". They are very sturdy and durable, for the money, and can be safely hung for my rabbits. :-D They are also tall enough to creat a rabbit loft. My rabbits love them. :-)
customer_reviews.author: Sussette Webster

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: I thought this was a great deal on a crate for my dog. Within a week the tray had cracked. My cat managed to break one of the bars. It would be fine for a dog that is well crate trained already but it will not hold up if the dog tries to get out at all.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca Ash

customer_reviews.title: May want to compare other brands
customer_reviews.text: A bit flimsy to be honest. The gate latches are not constructed well and my dog was able to get out.
customer_reviews.author: connieg

customer_reviews.title: This is wonderful. All you have to do to set up ...
customer_reviews.text: This is wonderful. All you have to do to set up is simply pull up the top, and the sides and bam. Very large, great size, have to keep my cat in their when I have company. but I put her bed on the end, and her food and water and she loves it. Folds down just as easily and slides right under my bed. Great purchase, great product, great price, great shipping.
customer_reviews.author: Diane

customer_reviews.title: Very Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: This kennel is great. Very high quality for the price. I had searched everywhere before purchasing and feel like I make the best deal for my money. These kennels are usually around $100 and with taxes and shipping I still spent less. Tray in bottom is removable for easy clean up and is also very sturdy. Highly recommend buying from here the kennel is great.
customer_reviews.author: Kaitlyn

customer_reviews.title: With this price, you have nothing to lose. Worth it!
customer_reviews.text: My French Bulldog somehow we asked his way out with all locks secured but we call it his condo because there is so much room for him to sprawl out and walk around on long days. We're planning on getting 2 pugs, they'll all fit comfortably for sure. I can't believe I gout a crate that sells for over $100 for under $40!
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Bigger than expected.  Wire isnt strong.
customer_reviews.text: Just go it today. Bigger than expected. Plenty of room for our 50lb pit bull. Our 80lb Lab would fit perfectly. Only complaint is the wires seems weak. If you have a feisty pup this isn't for you. Luckily our pit is calm and just chills in her bed and chews her bone so I'm sure it'll be fine for us.
customer_reviews.author: JESSICA

customer_reviews.title: Love it!!
customer_reviews.text: Love it!! I have had this for over 2 yrs now, it is still in great shape and I have a Mastiff! It is not tall enough for her to stand with her head up, but she has plenty of room to stand (with her head ducked down) and circle to reposition herself, she uses it as "her space" since I do have 2 children and there are times she just wants to be left alone :) Very well made, the only thing that did not last was the plastic "tray" but that is just because it is plastic and she was a puppy, very understandable.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: I have both of my puggle dogs in this kennel while I’m away at work. They have plenty of space and it’s great for the value!
customer_reviews.author: alexa bradley

customer_reviews.title: Poorly made dog kennel
customer_reviews.text: This kennel is extremely flimsy. The latches don't work properly because they move inside their housing. The side door is unusable for any dog that would need a kennel this size because the top comes down too low. The edges around the door were simply cut off so each bar has a rough edge that catches my greyhound's skin just about everytime she goes in. I would not recommend this product. Spend a little bit extra and buy from a local petstore.
customer_reviews.author: Nichole W

customer_reviews.title: Ripoff Pet Folding Crate
customer_reviews.text: The BestPet 42" Folding Dog Crate is of very poor quality, do not buy this product! The metal is extremely thin and after using it the weld for the metal parts has come apart. Now the cage is a safety hazard to my dog. When requesting a refund, I was denied by Emily from Best Massage Store. DO NOT BUY THIS PRODUCT OR YOU WILL BE DISAPPOINTED AND BEST MASSAGE STORE IS A RIPOFF.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia L. Weaver

customer_reviews.title: Totally Pleased!
customer_reviews.text: I am completely satisfied with this crate. The equivalent crates IN STORES are twice as much and seem to be identical. The only bad that I can say about this item is that the latches do not move very easily. On the upside, the latches have a 90 degree hook at the end that helps keep my 57lbs. pit bull contained. BUY IT (if you want)
customer_reviews.author: Sheridan

customer_reviews.title: great for smaller pets
customer_reviews.text: I actually kept my pet rabbit in this cage for a few years and she hadn't the slightest complaint, highly recommended for smaller critters to expand their world to something more than a foot or two of space. your pet will be content with the large doors on the front for easy access. with a metal construction this is pretty much the most sturdy and well built cage you'll be able to get for the price, without sacrificing space or accessibility.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis Sweet

customer_reviews.title: My dog loves it
customer_reviews.text: My foster dog loves it and so far she has not try to break out of it. I bought a cage for over $100 that is the same quality as this one. I recommend saving money and buying from here. You just have to be careful with the handles, they are different from my cages I bought from retail stores. I purchased my second one today for the times I go on vacation and have a dog sitter.
customer_reviews.author: ChrisVida

customer_reviews.title: Highly Recommend...
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this crate. We had an oversized crate for our Newf and need to down size for a rescue dog we were getting (Husky / Shepard / Lab). She is on the small size 30lbs at 5.5 months) but this crate works quite well. I absolutely love the set up, and the cost was FAR less than any we'd seen elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Fire Daniels

customer_reviews.title: Cage much to week, poor quility
customer_reviews.text: This cage's size is made for a 100+ pound dog; however the strength is made for a 20 pound pup. My 7 month old 55 lb Lab/pit mix has completely destroyed this cage. The bars are much too thin and the welds are even weaker. He has broken the welds and bent the bars in less than 3 hours. We put him in the cage, went out, and 3 hours later, when we returned he met us at the door. The cage is unusable. I would not recommend this cage for any dog over 20 lbs. Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: dennis loccisano

product_meta.title: BestPet Dog Crate for Large Medium Dogs Dog Cage Kennel 48/42Inches Pet Playpen Folding Indoor Outdoor Double Door Travel Metal Dog Pen with Plastic Tray
product_meta.description:
Size:42"These premium quality BestPet metal pet crates are crafted using commercial-quality materials and superior manufacturing. The crates feature multiple doors that lock easily with a slide-bolt latch. Finished with a durable black Electro-coat finish, these crates are rust, corrosion, and fade resistant even in extreme climates. To set-up, simply unbox and fold open; no tools are required. Each crate features a lightweight, slide-out tray made of durable ABS plastic. The tray features a lip around the perimeter and is held in place with a retaining bar making it easy to remove and clean without needing to open the crate door. With the rounded edges of the crates, your pet cannot injure themselves on any sharp metal pieces.

Features
✔Set-up and fold-down in seconds, no tools needed 
✔A front and a side door for convenience 
✔Two Bolt Latches for each door,Keep pup safe 
✔Tough ABS plastic pan easy to clean 
✔Protable split divider
✔Sturdy metal construction
✔Durable antirust black epoxy coating
✔Travel Safe - Take it anywhere
✔Rounded Edges to protect pet
✔Fully Assembled, just open and fold
